{
  "name": "@vivotek/app-reseller-portal",
  "version": "3.11.0",
  "config": {
    "sprintNumber": 80
  },
  "private": true,
  "type": "module",
  "scripts": {
    "amplify-pull": "chmod +x ./amplify-headless-init.sh && ./amplify-headless-init.sh",
    "copy-aws-config": "cp ./awsconfig/$ENV/aws-exports.js ./src/",
    "serve:vite": "vite --port 8080 --mode \"${ENV_MODE:-$ENV}\"",
    "serve:env": "pnpm run copy-aws-config && pnpm run serve:vite",
    "serve:test": "ENV=dev ENV_MODE=test pnpm run serve:env",
    "serve:dev": "ENV=dev pnpm run serve:env",
    "serve:dev:mn": "ENV=dev ENV_MODE=dev.marchnetworks pnpm run serve:env",
    "serve:stage": "ENV=preprod pnpm run serve:env",
    "serve:stage:mn": "ENV=preprod ENV_MODE=preprod.marchnetworks pnpm run serve:env",
    "serve:prod": "ENV=prod pnpm run serve:env",
    "serve:prod:mn": "ENV=prod ENV_MODE=prod.marchnetworks pnpm run serve:env",
    "build": "vite build",
    "preview": "vite build --mode dev && vite preview --port 8080",
    "test:unit": "vitest",
    "test:e2e": "start-server-and-test preview http://localhost:4173 'cypress run --e2e'",
    "test:e2e:dev": "start-server-and-test 'vite dev --port 4173' http://localhost:4173 'cypress open --e2e'",
    "release": "semantic-release -e semantic-release-monorepo",
    "lint": "eslint . --ext .vue,.js,.jsx,.cjs,.mjs --fix --ignore-path .gitignore",
    "format": "prettier --write src/",
    "storybook": "storybook dev -p 6006",
    "build-storybook": "storybook build",
    "upload-i18n": "tool-i18n-converter upload --config 'translation-config.json'",
    "update-i18n": "tool-i18n-converter update --config 'translation-config.json'",
    "update-mock:vortex": "msw-auto-mock src/openapi/vortex.json -o src/mocks/vortex -m 5 --base-url https://api.dev.backend.vortexcloud.com",
    "parse-translations": "tool-i18n-converter parse --config 'translation-config.json'",
    "gen-msw": "msw init ./public --save",
    "translate:portal": "tool-ai-translator translate:reseller-portal",
    "check:tenants-files": "node ./scripts/check-tenants-files.js",
    "hotfix": "chmod +x ./scripts/release/hotfix.sh && ./scripts/release/hotfix.sh"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@vivotek/lib-aws-amplify": "workspace:*",
    "@vivotek/lib-utility": "workspace:*",
    "@vivotek/vue-user-behavior-tracker": "workspace:*",
    "@vivotek/lib-remote-config": "workspace:*",
    "eslint-plugin-no-relative-import-paths": "^1.6.1",
    "events": "^3.3.0",
    "jodit-vue": "^3.1.0",
    "pinia": "^2.1.7",
    "vite-plugin-env-compatible": "^2.0.1",
    "vue": "^3.5.12",


<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.text:
## Development Setup

You will need [Node.js](http://nodejs.org) **version 6+**

After cloning the repo, run:

``` bash
$ pnpm install
```

### Commonly used pnpm scripts

``` bash
### Start dev server with hot reload
$ pnpm serve

### Check for errors
$ pnpm lint

### Build everything
$ pnpm build
```

The other tasks on package.json **SHOULD NOT** be executed.

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.text:
# Contributing to NWR - [Commit Message Guidelines](#commit) ## Commit Message Format *This specification is inspired by and supersedes the [AngularJS commit message format][commit-message-format].* We have very precise rules over how our Git commit messages must be formatted. This format leads to **easier to read commit history**. Each commit message consists of a **header**, a **body**, and a **footer**. ```
``` The `header` is mandatory and must conform to the [Commit Message Header](#commit-header) format. The `body` is optional. When the body is present it must be at least 20 characters long and must conform to the [Commit Message Body](#commit-body) format. The `footer` is optional. The [Commit Message Footer](#commit-footer) format describes what the footer is used for and the structure it must have. Any line of the commit message cannot be longer than 100 characters. #### Commit Message Header ``` (): â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â«¸ Subject including issue id and precise decription of what you do â”‚ â”‚ Sample: [NWR-1001] add semantic release and ready to trigger 1.0.0 (for jira issues) â”‚ â”‚ Sample: [#123456] add semantic release and ready to trigger 1.0.0 (for redmine issues) â”‚ â”‚ â”‚ â””â”€â«¸ Commit Scope: login|liveview|playback|store|services|${component}|${TO_BE_DEFINED_LATER} â”‚ â””â”€â«¸ Commit Type: chore|docs|feat|fix|perf|refactor|test|style ``` The `` and `` fields are mandatory, the `()` field is optional. In ``, the format is ``` [ISSUE-ID-WITH-PREFIX] ``` The `[ISSUE-ID-WITH-PREFIX] ` part is optional if you are doing a really tiny change without code behavior/bug fix. ##### Type Must be one of the following: * **feat**: A new feature * **fix**: A bug fix * **docs**: Documentation only changes * **style**: White space, formatting, semi colons change. (NOT css styles change) * **refactor**: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature * **perf**: A code change that improves performance * **test**: Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests * **chore**: Changes to our CI configuration files and scripts (example scopes: Circle, BrowserStack, SauceLabs) or build system Currently, ont **feat** introduces MINOR changes. All others excluding **test** and **chore** introduces PATCH changes. **test** and **chore** will not affect release versions. In most cases you should choose one from **feat**, **fix**, and **refactor**. ##### Scope The scope should be the name of the package/page/module/component/group affected (as perceived by the person reading the changelog generated from commit messages). This is not strictly defined, so feel free to name it now. Will have more precise scope later. The following is a list of possible scopes: * `liveview` * `playback` * `login` * `store` * `router` * `i18n` ##### Summary Use the summary field to provide a succinct description of the change: * use the imperative, present tense: "change" not "changed" nor "changes" * no dot (.) at the end #### Commit Message Body Just as in the summary, use the imperative, present tense: "fix" not "fixed" nor "fixes". Explain the motivation for the change in the commit message body. This commit message should explain _why_ you are making the change. You can include a comparison of the previous behavior with the new behavior in order to illustrate the impact of the change. Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.

content.text:
name: pnpm
description: Execute pnpm script
inputs:
  working-directory:
    description: "Working directory"
    required: true
  script:
    description: "Script to execute"
    default: ""
    required: false
  node-version:
    description: "Node version"
    default: '20'
    required: false

runs:
  using: composite
  steps:
    - name: Set pnpm destination directory
      shell: bash
      run: |
        if [ "${{ runner.environment }}" == "github-hosted" ]; then
          echo "PNPM_DEST=$HOME/setup-pnpm" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        else
          echo "PNPM_DEST=$HOME/${{ runner.name }}/setup-pnpm" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        fi

    - uses: pnpm/action-setup@v4
      name: Install pnpm
      with:
        dest: ${{ env.PNPM_DEST }}
        run_install: false

    - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
      with:
        node-version: "22.16.0"

    - name: Set pnpm store directory (self-hosted)
      if: runner.environment != 'github-hosted'
      shell: bash
      run: |
        STORE_DIR="$HOME/pnpm-store/${{ runner.name }}"
        CACHE_META_DIR="$HOME/pnpm-cache-meta/${{ runner.name }}"
        mkdir -p "$STORE_DIR" "$CACHE_META_DIR"
        pnpm config set store-dir "$STORE_DIR"
        echo "PNPM_STORE_DIR=$STORE_DIR" >> $GITHUB_ENV
        echo "PNPM_CACHE_META_DIR=$CACHE_META_DIR" >> $GITHUB_ENV

    - name: Validate cache against lockfile (self-hosted)
      if: runner.environment != 'github-hosted'
      shell: bash
      run: |
        set -e
        HASH_FILE="${PNPM_CACHE_META_DIR}/lockfile-hash"
        CURRENT_HASH="${{ hashFiles('**/pnpm-lock.yaml') }}"

        echo "=== Lockfile Cache Validation ==="
        echo "Hash file path: $HASH_FILE"
        echo "Current lockfile hash: $CURRENT_HASH"

        # æª¢æŸ¥ lockfile hash æ˜¯å¦æœ‰æ•ˆ
        if [ -z "$CURRENT_HASH" ]; then
          echo "::error::Cannot compute lockfile hash. No pnpm-lock.yaml found?"
          exit 1
        fi

        NEED_PRUNE=false
        NEED_CLEAR=false

        if [ -f "$HASH_FILE" ]; then
          STORED_HASH=$(cat "$HASH_FILE")
          echo "Stored lockfile hash: $STORED_HASH"

          if [ "$STORED_HASH" != "$CURRENT_HASH" ]; then
            echo "::warning::Lockfile CHANGED - stored hash does not match current hash"
            NEED_PRUNE=true
          else
            echo "::notice::Lockfile UNCHANGED - cache is valid, skipping integrity check"
          fi
        else
          echo "::notice::First run - no previous hash found, will initialize"
        fi

        # åŸ·è¡Œ prune (ç•¶ lockfile æ”¹è®Šæ™‚)
        if [ "$NEED_PRUNE" = true ]; then
          echo "Running pnpm store prune..."
          if ! pnpm store prune; then
            echo "::warning::Store prune failed, will clear store directory"
            NEED_CLEAR=true
          fi
        fi

        # æ¸…ç©º store (ç•¶ prune å¤±æ•—æ™‚)
        if [ "$NEED_CLEAR" = true ]; then
          echo "Clearing store directory..."
          rm -rf "${PNPM_STORE_DIR:?}"/*
          mkdir -p "$PNPM_STORE_DIR"
          echo "Store directory cleared"
        fi

        # æ›´æ–° hash æª”æ¡ˆ
        echo "$CURRENT_HASH" > "$HASH_FILE"
        echo "Hash file updated successfully"

    - name: Get pnpm store directory
      shell: bash
      run: |
        echo "STORE_PATH=$(pnpm store path --silent)" >> $GITHUB_ENV

    - name: Cache pnpm store (github-hosted)
      if: runner.environment == 'github-hosted'
      uses: actions/cache@v4
      with:
        path: ${{ env.STORE_PATH }}
        key: pnpm-store-${{ runner.os }}-${{ runner.arch }}-${{ hashFiles('**/pnpm-lock.yaml') }}
        restore-keys: |
          pnpm-store-${{ runner.os }}-${{ runner.arch }}-
          pnpm-store-${{ runner.os }}-
          pnpm-store-

    - name: Execute script
      working-directory: ${{ inputs.working-directory }}
      shell: bash
      env:
        HUSKY: 0
      run: |
        pnpm install --frozen-lockfile

    - name: Execute script
      working-directory: ${{ inputs.working-directory }}
      shell: bash
      if: ${{ inputs.script }}
      run: ${{ inputs.script }}


<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

content.text:
name: app-nvr-reforged
run-name: app-nvr-reforged style check, unit test & build
on:
  pull_request:
    types: [ opened, synchronize, reopened ]
    paths: packages/app-nvr-reforged/**
  push:
    branches:
      - main
      - 'nvr/**'
    paths: packages/app-nvr-reforged/**
  workflow_call:

env:
  WORKING_DIR: packages/app-nvr-reforged

concurrency:
  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

jobs:
  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Check out repository code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - name: Use lint action
        uses: ./.github/actions/pnpmv2
        with:
          working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
          script: pnpm lint

      - name: Use unit-test action
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: pnpm test:strict

      - name: Export file name
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          echo WORKING_DATE=$(date +'%Y-%m-%d--%H-%M') >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo WORKING_HASH=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo VUE_APP_VERSION=$(date +'%Y-%m-%d--%H-%M')--$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) > .env

      - name: Use build action
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: pnpm build

content.text:
name: app-reseller-portal
run-name: app-reseller-portal style check, unit test & build
on:
  pull_request:
    types: [ opened, synchronize, reopened ]
    paths: packages/app-reseller-portal/**
  push:
    branches:
      - main
    paths: packages/app-reseller-portal/**
  workflow_call:
  workflow_dispatch:
env:
  WORKING_DIR: packages/app-reseller-portal

concurrency:
  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

jobs:
  check-and-build:
    runs-on: self-hosted
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup dependencies
        uses: ./.github/actions/pnpmv2
        with:
          working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
          script: |
            pnpm amplify-pull

      - name: Run lint
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: pnpm lint

      - name: Run unit tests
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: pnpm test:unit

      - name: Build
        working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
        run: |
          echo VUE_APP_VERSION=$(date +'%Y-%m-%d--%H-%M')--$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) > .env
          pnpm build

      - name: Export file name
        run: |
          echo WORKING_DATE=$(date +'%Y-%m-%d--%H-%M') >> $GITHUB_ENV
          echo WORKING_HASH=$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) >> $GITHUB_ENV

name: app-one-portal
run-name: app-one-portal style check, unit test & build
on:
  pull_request:
    types: [ opened, synchronize, reopened, labeled ]
    paths: packages/app-one-portal/**

  push:
    branches:
      - main
    paths: packages/app-one-portal/**

  # GMT+0 every Monday at 06:30 AM(GMT+8)
  schedule:
    - cron:  '30 22 * * 0'

  workflow_call:
  workflow_dispatch:

env:
  WORKING_DIR: packages/app-one-portal
  CHROMATIC_PROJECT_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.CHROMATIC_PROJECT_TOKEN_ONE_PORTAL }}

# To cancel previous runs of the same workflow, you can use the concurrency key.
concurrency:
  group: ${{ github.workflow }}-${{ github.ref }}
  cancel-in-progress: true

jobs:
  set-output:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      CHROMATIC_DEPLOY_STORYBOOK: ${{ steps.set-env.outputs.CHROMATIC_DEPLOY_STORYBOOK }}
      IS_ACTION_LABELED: ${{ steps.set-env.outputs.IS_ACTION_LABELED }}
    steps:
      - name: Set environment variable
        id: set-env
        run: |
          echo "CHROMATIC_DEPLOY_STORYBOOK=${{ contains(github.event.pull_request.labels.*.name, 'deploy-storybook') }}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "IS_ACTION_LABELED=${{ github.event.action == 'labeled' }}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT

  lint:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Check out repository code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Use lint action
        uses: ./.github/actions/pnpmv2
        with:
          working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
          script: pnpm lint

  unit-test:
    needs: lint
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - name: Check out repository code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Execute unit test
        uses: ./.github/actions/pnpmv2
        with:
          working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
          script: |
            echo VUE_APP_VERSION=$(date +'%Y-%m-%d--%H-%M')--$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) > .env
            pnpm test:unit

  # please keep the following commented code for future reference
  # chromatic-deploy-for-review:
  #   needs: [lint, set-output]
  #   if: ${{ needs.set-output.outputs.CHROMATIC_DEPLOY_STORYBOOK == 'true' && needs.set-output.outputs.IS_ACTION_LABELED == 'true' }}
  #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
  #   steps:
  #     - uses: actions/checkout@v4
  #       with:
  #         fetch-depth: 0 # Required to retrieve git history

  #     - name: Execute Build Storybook for one-portal
  #       uses: ./.github/actions/pnpmv2
  #       with:
  #         working-directory: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
  #         script: |
  #           echo VUE_APP_VERSION=$(date +'%Y-%m-%d--%H-%M')--$(git rev-parse --short HEAD) > .env
  #           pnpm amplify-pull
  #           pnpm build-storybook

  #     - name: Publish to Chromatic for UI review/testing
  #       uses: chromaui/action@latest
  #       with:
  #         projectToken: ${{ env.CHROMATIC_PROJECT_TOKEN }}
  #         workingDir: ${{ env.WORKING_DIR }}
  #         storybookBuildDir: storybook-static
  #         exitZeroOnChanges: true
  #         onlyStoryFiles: 'src/components/base/**/*.stories.*'

  chromatic-deploy-storybook-only:
    needs: [lint, set-output]
    if: ${{ needs.set-output.outputs.CHROMATIC_DEPLOY_STORYBOOK == 'true' }}
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
